newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina's Molinos issues $150 mln 10-year bond.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Molinos issues $150 mln 10-year bond.

text.p: Argentine food manufacturer Molinos Rio de la Plata SA has sold $150 million in negotiable bonds guaranteed by exports, the company said in a statement Tuesday.

The issue, due in October 2006, was sold at par and carries a fixed rate of 9.11 percent. Citicorp Securities Inc. was the issuing agent of the bond outside Argentina while Citicorp Capital Markets SA acted as agent locally.
Interest will be paid twice yearly. The first payment is due on April 22 next year. The bond will be guaranteed by two export contracts of soybeans and wheat.
According to Ricardo Munoz de Toro, the firm's legal representative, this is the first Argentine bond that is guaranteed by soybean and wheat exports.
Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co. has given the bond a credit rating of BBB minus.
The company hopes the issue will trade on the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange.
